abstract: Going back 207 years, stocks have outdone bonds by 2.5 percentage points, annualized. But for some long periods, bonds have been the leader.
snippet: Going back 207 years, stocks have outdone bonds by 2.5 percentage points, annualized. But for some long periods, bonds have been the leader.
lead_paragraph: WHEN the Dow Jones industrial average climbed back to 10,000 this month, the achievement was widely noted but barely celebrated, and for good reason.

headline.main: In This 10-Year Race, Bonds Win by a Mile
headline.print_headline: In This 10-Year Race, Bonds Win by a Mile
